p: Water stress adversely affects both source and sink strength in plants. Photosynthesis and biomass production are reduced by water stress. New biomass production decreases proportionally to the response of photosynthesis to water stress ( W sa ). The rate of leaf senescence increases under water stress due to the modification in daily increment of thermal time by a factor termed maximum acceleration of leaf senescence due to water stress ( W ss ). Earlier leaf senescence will reduce grain yield due to reduction in intercepted radiation and photosynthesis and also reduction in translocation of the labile plant reserve carbohydrate to the grain due to premature termination of grain filling. Drought tolerance traits such as reduced W sa and W ss could be beneficial in rainfed conditions under drought ( Semenov et al., 2009, 2014; Semenov and Halford, 2009).
